abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Dushanbe Water Supply
            Project for Tajikistan were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            substantial; Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory;
            and borrower performance was also moderately unsatisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: balancing infrastructure
            rehabilitation and service improvement emergencies with
            operating performance and institutional reform expectations.
            Need to tailor resources to implementation challenges.
            Don't wait to restructure projects with compromised
            outlook. The project should have been restructured, with
            relevant updates to the implementation arrangements and the
            results framework. Risk mitigation through conservative
            goal-setting and robust results framework.
